info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 7:28PM EDT until September 07 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Union County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 727 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Monroe, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Monroe, Indian Trail, Weddington, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Wingate, Waxhaw, Marshville, Mineral Springs, Marvin, Sturdivants, Jaars, and Trinity. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
